title: How does one get a PhD in Music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do a Bachelor Degree with a music major.Do an Honours year or Masters.Apply to do a PhD.You will need to have a research topic, submit a recorded performance and a minor thesis/commentary about the performance.Topics are usually centred around a particular body of works or performance practice issues. Alternatively, you an do a PhD in Musicology which does not require performance. Research projects are usually centred on music history, composers, compositions, instruments or performance practice,
